title: Will Ebola, Terror Attacks Roil Election?
teaser: NPR's Ron Elving explores how Ebola has overshadowed many political issues and how it will affect elections.
contentencoded:
News of the Ebola quarantine in New York and New Jersey has knocked recent lone wolf terrorism attacks out of the headlines.

And good news such as the lowest gas prices in four years is overshadowed too. Which party will benefit most as we count down to election day in just over one week?

NPR’s Ron Elving joins Here & Now‘s Robin Young to explore these questions.

Guest

  • Ron Elving, senior Washington editor for NPR. He tweets @relving.
